creditline: Lent by Laura Tiffany and Family
description: seated man viewed from torso up; man has long hair and wears white collar and black robe; PR hand holding writing instrument over paper; gilded frame
text: Samuel Checkley (1696-1769) was a prominent Congregational minister in the Boston area who promoted an orderly, productive society based on strong families.  In 1732 he published The Diary of the Rev. Samuel Checkley, a memoir that reveals a great deal about his personal experiences in early New England.  The painting's gilt frame is the original, also made in Boston.
title: Portrait of Dr. Samuel Checkly
